page.title: 02Farming the Adur Valley
page.content: Main{crops}are cereals but some oil-seed rape, peas, beans, kale and potatoes are also cultivated. Grass is grown for conversion into hay and silage for winter feed.{ { { Livestock}includes cattle, sheep, pigs, goats and chickens. Cattle (cross-bred) are reared on several farms for beef. There is one dairy herd of 140 pedigree Guernsey cows at Chestham. Sheep are reared for both wool and meat, usually as a secondary source of income. There is one pig unit (pork and bacon) at Blacklands Farm, one goat unit (milk and cheese) at Shermanbury and a fish farm at Shermanbury Place.
